# Bottlenose Dolphin (*Turiops truncatus*)

General information:

* Lots of sinusoidal whistles  
* Can be difficult to distinguish from Atlantic spotted dolphins  
* Bottlenose dolphins use signature whistles (although this is not unique to the species)  
  * Predominant whistle contours remain stable over long periods of time, 17 years (Harley, 2007\)  
* Documented geographic variation, namely when comparing the Gulf of Mexico and western Atlantic (Baron et al, 2008\)

Whistles:

* Frequency  
  * Avg min 7.33, max 16.24, range 8.91 kHz in western north Atlantic  
  * (Portugal data) Average fqs in kHz (dos Santos et al, 2005\)  
    * Initial 5.8  
    * Final 12.1  
    * Max 15  
    * Min 5.4  
    * Peak 9.2  
* Duration  
  * Average duration of 1.3 in western north Atlantic (Steiner, 1981\)  
  * (Portugal data) 859 ms with min/max of 257-4130ms (dos Santos et al, 2005\)  
* Waveform  
  * Can have a range of inflection points, but Steiner (1981) recorded an average of 2.86
